description: System-wide unique asset identifier for this equipment record.
Owning or operating company/business unit code.
Internal unique ID for the equipment header record.
Identifier of the master/parent asset for component or child assets; 0 if none.
Estimated replacement cost for the asset; confirm with SME.
Indicator linking this record to a master asset hierarchy; confirm exact meaning with SME.
Indicates whether the vehicle is equipped with air conditioning (Y/N).
Billing code used for chargebacks or allocations related to this asset.
Flag indicating cost-center applicability or special charging; confirm with SME.
Equipment class/type code used for categorization and reporting.
Exterior color of the vehicle/equipment.
Primary descriptive text about the asset.
Secondary notes or annotations about the asset.
Additional notes or special instructions about the asset.
Conversion indicator (e.g., converted from another system or configuration); confirm with SME.
Acquisition cost paid to procure the asset.
Cost adjustment or discount amount associated with acquisition; confirm with SME.
Depreciation rate or driver used in cost calculations; confirm with SME.
Code representing device/type/category for tracking or billing; confirm with SME.
Drive or drivetrain type code (e.g., front-, rear-, or four-wheel drive); confirm mapping.
Acquisition/purchase date.
Date when the record was last modified.
Date the asset was disposed/retired; 0 or blank if not disposed.
Planned expiration or end-of-life date for the asset.
Date of most recent reservation; 0 if never reserved.
Date the asset entered service.
Periodic depreciation expense charged to the asset; confirm period (monthly/annual) with SME.
Owning/charging department or cost center.
Assigned operator/driver or responsible employee.
Engine displacement and configuration.
Primary fuel tank capacity.
Secondary/auxiliary fuel tank capacity.
Primary fuel type.
Secondary fuel type.
Additional fuel type code, if applicable; confirm with SME.
Gross vehicle weight rating.
Insured value or coverage limit for the asset; confirm with SME.
Insurance charge allocated to this asset.
Primary key/lock code or identifier; confirm usage with SME.
Secondary key/lock code or identifier; confirm usage with SME.
Lease identification or status for the asset; confirm with SME.
Vehicle registration/license plate number.
Expected service life in months.
Manufacturer/brand.
Miscellaneous user-defined code or attribute; confirm with SME.
Manufacturer model name/designation.
Monitoring or maintenance grouping code used for scheduling and reporting.
Monthly ownership/lease charge billed to the department.
Engine oil capacity.
User ID or operator who last modified the record.
Current reservation status/count for the asset (e.g., 0 = none).
Purchase order number used to acquire the asset.
Disposition or delivery note related to the PO (e.g., auction); confirm with SME.
Priority code for maintenance, assignment, or replacement; confirm code definitions.
Radio equipment identifier/presence indicator; confirm with SME.
Rate plan code used to calculate internal charges.
Seasonal usage charge or factor applied to billing; confirm with SME.
Serial number or VIN.
Assigned maintenance shop/location code.
Site/location code where the asset is stationed.
High-level status of the asset (e.g., active or inactive).
Detailed status or disposition code; confirm definitions.
Time of last modification (HHMMSS).
Primary/front tire size specification.
Secondary/rear tire size specification.
Vehicle title number/reference; confirm with SME.
Title/document set category for the asset; confirm with SME.
Transmission type and number of speeds.
Rate charged per unit of use (mile, hour, etc.).
Unit on which usage cost is based (e.g., mile or hour); confirm with SME.
Vendor/supplier name associated with acquisition or service.
Vendor display/long name or description.
Model year of the asset.
Supplier identifier/reference; 0 if unknown; confirm with SME.
Indicates whether the asset belongs to a shared motor pool.
Funding source or accounting fund code.
Major asset group/category code.
Condition adjustment factor used in valuation or replacement modeling.
Inflation rate used in cost or replacement forecasting.
Estimated salvage value rate as a percentage of cost.
Amount of recovered charges collected to date.
Maintenance cost life-to-date.
Date the asset was taken out of service.
Hourly internal rental or usage charge.
Date associated with project management tracking for this asset; confirm purpose with SME.
Physical location or region designation.
Record creation date.
Indicates whether additional notes exist for this asset.
Flag indicating presence of an associated image/graphic.
Cash proceeds received from sale or disposal.
